publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-3494# Rhoda Grant: Alain Baxter-That the Parliament deplores the failure of the Court of Arbitration for Sport to award Alain Baxter the bronze medal which he won during the 2002 Winter Olympics in Salt Lake City; notes that the court described Alain Baxter, in its verdict, as "a sincere and honest man" and that he did not intend to gain a competitive advantage, and considers that the bronze medal should be returned to Mr Baxter immediately and that the British Olympic Association should withdraw its ban on him from competing in the 2006 Winter Olympics in Turin.

S1M-3494# Rhoda Grant: Alain Baxter-That the Parliament deplores the failure of the Court of Arbitration for Sport to award Alain Baxter the bronze medal which he won during the 2002 Winter Olympics in Salt Lake City; notes that the court described Alain Baxter, in its verdict, as "a sincere and honest man" and that he did not intend to gain a competitive advantage, and considers that the bronze medal should be returned to Mr Baxter immediately and that the British Olympic Association should withdraw its ban on him from competing in the 2006 Winter Olympics in Turin.
S1M-3494# Alain Baxter (lodged on 21 October 2002) Christine Grahame*, Alex Neil*, Irene Oldfather*
S1M-3494# Alain Baxter (lodged on 21 October 2002) Bill Butler*
S1M-3494# Alain Baxter (lodged on 21 October 2002) Scott Barrie*
S1M-3494# Alain Baxter (lodged on 21 October 2002) Mr Gil Paterson*
S1M-3494# Alain Baxter (lodged on 21 October 2002) Mr Kenneth Gibson*
S1M-3494# Alain Baxter (lodged on 21 October 2002) Ms Sandra White*
